body.p:
Stanford 17" November 1864
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Governor of Kenty

The undersigned citizens of Lincoln County respectfully represent that from information upon whilst we rely; we believe it is the intention of the authorities of both state and Federal Government to keep as far as possible a company of soldiers in Each County in this State. Capt Jas Bridgewater has ruined a company in this County principally our own citizens and me by your Excellency. to station as far as possible that company in the County of Lincoln; we are acquainted with the members of said Company and believe it the interest of the County to retain them here when not on active duty_ and do not want strangers in our midst when we have a company of our own we would not if we knew it ask my favor of your Excellency Contrary to the itnerest of the State; we beg an early response to Judge W. G. Bailey --

T. P. Hill
W. G. Bailey
J A Harris
H. T. Harris.
George McRoberts.
John C. Cooper
A. S. Myers
R. Carson
R. H. Wearen
Jos. Severance
Edwin McRoberts
J. N. Craig
McPenoliton
C. B. Huffman
W H Hays-
(over)
Governor: our entire population would sign this Petition, but these we deem sufficient to indicate the will and desire of all.

Truly your friend
W. G. Bailey

Scouts
Stanford Ky.
Nov. 17th 1864.
Bailey W. G. & others
To The Gov.
Request that Capt Bridgewater compy. may be stationed in Lincoln Co. for the protection of citizens of that County-
Recd A. G. O. Nov 26th 1864

His Excellency-
Thos E Bramlette.
Frankfort.
Ky.

Inspector Genl
Bridgewaters Company will be kept for that county & adjacent defenses-
